concept.title: What is Troubleshooting?
concept.shortdesc: 'Troubleshooting' is a common technology term that means finding the source of a device's performance issues or errors. It's important to know what it means and how to do it!

section.p: If you've ever turned your phone or laptop off and back on again to fix a slow internet connection, you've engaged in troubleshooting! Troubleshooting Wi-Fi routers can take many forms, including:

ul.li: Checking for physical damage to the hardware, like dust build-up or scratches
Restarting the router or disconnecting and reconnecting the internet connection
Updating the software or replacing hardware parts
Moving the router to a safer or more efficient location
Checking the router settings for any necessary adjustments
